arts.ttl: Arsenal v Brighton, Swansea v Manchester City and more: Carabao Cup clockwatch – live
arts.sum: ⚽️ League Cup updates from 7.45pm GMT kick-offs ⚽️ Football Daily: Shamrock Rovers’ title stumble ⚽️ Live scoreboard | Email Michael with your thoughts This is what Mikel Arteta had to say about Max Dowman in the lead up to Arsenal’s match against Brighton. The 15-year-old signed scholarship terms with Arsenal last week, with a professional contract due to be finalised for his 17th birthday. He joined as a five‑year‑old and the hope is that he will stay for the long term. [Dowman staying is] what we all want. I think what he wants as well. After that it is more for [the sporting director] Andrea [Berta] and the club. But the feeling that I have is that genuinely he loves it here. He is a huge Arsenal supporter and his family are really happy with the way things are developing around him as well. Hopefully for many years he will be with us. If we looked at his passport every day we would never play him, simple as that. So it is finding a balance, an understanding, especially the load, the things that are changing in his life, and making sure he can cope with that. So far, he has done that. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Wolves, Chelsea starting lineups confirmed! Pereira, Maresca both make wholesale changes
arts.sum: Wolverhampton Wanderers and Chelsea announce their starting lineups for Wednesday's EFL Cup fourth round tie at Molineux.

arts.ttl: Wolves v Chelsea live: Team news as Estevao set to start in rotated Blues line-up for Carabao Cup tie
arts.sum: Both Wolves and Chelsea were left reeling by last-gasp Premier League defeats at the weekend but a place in the Carabao Cup last eight would restore morale

arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca drops Pedro Neto verdict as former Wolves winger set for latest Molineux return
arts.sum: Wolves could certainly do with a player like Pedro Neto right about now – and Enzo Maresca has given his latest thoughts about the winger he plucked from Molineux 18 months ago. Pereira will be hoping Neto is one player Maresca rotates out of the side tomorrow night, because he’s enjoyed a good season so far.

Wolves have endured a dismal start to the 2025-26 Premier League season, earning just two points from nine matches to sit bottom of the table, and remain winless in the league following a 3-2 defeat t...

arts.ttl: Chelsea XI vs Wolves – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Chelsea make the trip to Wolves in the fourth round of the Carabao Cup this evening. After winning the Europa Conference League and Club World Cup under Enzo Maresca, the Blues are bidding to reach the latter stages of the EFL Cup this season. arts.ttl: Wolves vs Chelsea – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Wolves host Chelsea in the Carabao Cup tonight looking to bounce back from recent woes. Vitor Pereira’s position is under threat after opening the Premier League season with a nine-game winless run. The manager and players clashed with fans following defeat to Burnley at the weekend. arts.ttl: What Enzo Maresca said ahead of Wolves vs Chelsea will put Vitor Pereira on red alert
arts.sum: Wolves are back in Carabao Cup action tomorrow night against Chelsea at Molineux – and one admission Enzo Maresca made is bound to have caught Vitor Pereira’s attention. Enzo Maresca planning to rotate against Wolves

arts.ttl: Merson: Chelsea are a cup team - and Wolves clash is massive
arts.sum: Paul Merson says Chelsea's lack of experience is a massive factor in their inconsistent Premier League form, but he believes they still have the talent to continue to do well in cup competitions.
